meanings.definition: A group of people or vehicles moving forward in an orderly fashion, especially as part of a ceremony or festival.
meanings.sent1: The procession of students marched proudly during the graduation ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The royal procession made its way through the streets, attracting crowds of onlookers.
meanings.sent3: The procession of ducks waddled in a line, looking quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The procession of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The colorful procession of balloons filled the sky with joy.

meanings.definition: The act of moving forward in an orderly fashion, especially as part of a ceremony or festival.
meanings.sent1: The slow procession of ants carrying food back to their nest fascinated the children.
meanings.sent2: The solemn procession of mourners followed the casket to the cemetery.
meanings.sent3: The procession of toy cars on the track was like a tiny race.
meanings.sent4: The procession of thoughts in her mind was like a never-ending parade.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic procession of waves crashing on the shore was calming.
